qas.question: The floor mosaic in Butrint is how much older than that of the Baptistry?
What type of message was left on the mosaics at Butrint?
What was the mosaic at Butrint designed to portray?
The Vrina Plain basilica is in which city?

context: The mosaic pavement of the Vrina Plain basilica of <a4_0>Butrint<a4_0/>, <a1_0>Albania<a1_0/> appear to pre-date that of the Baptistery by <a0_0>almost a generation<a0_0/>, dating to the last quarter of the 5th or the first years of the 6th century. The mosaic displays a variety of motifs including sea-creatures, birds, terrestrial beasts, fruits, flowers, trees and abstracts – designed to depict <a3_0>a terrestrial paradise<a3_0/> of God’s creation. Superimposed on this scheme are two large tablets, tabulae ansatae, carrying inscriptions. A variety of fish, a crab, a lobster, shrimps, mushrooms, flowers, a stag and two cruciform designs surround the smaller of the two inscriptions, which reads: In fulfilment of the vow (<a2_0>prayer<a2_0/>) of those whose names God knows. This anonymous dedicatory inscription is a public demonstration of the benefactors’ humility and an acknowledgement of God’s omniscience.
